title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 25 March 2015 - XWiki
content:
<lucaa> has quit  
00:33 <abusenius> has quit  
04:28 <tillo> has quit  
04:30 <tillo> has joined #xwiki  
06:01 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
06:04 <Denis> has quit  
06:23 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:03 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:45 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:48 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
08:11 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:22 <DarkKnightCZ> Hi, where can i find Parser that does html/4.01 syntax rendering?  
08:25 <vfzevaze> has joined #xwiki  
08:28 <vmassol> has quit  
08:29 <cjd> has quit  
08:32 <vfzevaze> hello there! does someone have knowledge about the application-encryption macro? https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-encryption  
08:34 <vfzevaze> it does not matter what i do get always: "You are not allowed to decrypt this password"  
08:36 <vfzevaze> using xwiki 6.4.2  
08:45 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:54 <vfzevaze> @application-encryption (xwiki 6.4.2): it seams that only the admin is beeing able to edit and manage the encrypted data  
09:15 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:29 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
09:31 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:31 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:31 <vmassol> hi DarkKnightCZ it's here https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/tree/master/xwiki-rendering-syntaxes/xwiki-rendering-syntax-html  
09:33 <DarkKnightCZ> vmassol: heh, there is xwiki-rendering project, missed that, thanks  
09:33 <DarkKnightCZ> i believe this is still valid, right? (the thing about links) http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/How+to+convert+HTML+pages+into+wiki+pages  
09:35 <vmassol> yes  
09:35 <DarkKnightCZ> okay, thanks

14:03 <Slashman> has quit  
14:31 <lucaa> has quit  
14:31 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:33 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:40 <tmortagne> vmassol: your change in script macro broke several groovy and velocity unit tests  
14:40 <vmassol> argh  
14:40 <vmassol> ah just the tests, ok  
14:41 <tmortagne> well  
14:41 <vmassol> checking ci  
14:41 <tmortagne> it's not just testing  
14:41 <tmortagne> there is a change in the logic  
14:41 <tmortagne> for example there is a velocity macro that used to not print anything and now does  
14:42 <tmortagne> I guess it's the same for the groovy tests failing  
14:42 <vmassol> hmm  
14:42 <tmortagne> it probably means that people get end up with things display they did not expected (because they did not used output=false I agree but still)  
14:43 <tmortagne> s/get/will/  
14:43 <tmortagne> did not really trough about that (I always use output=false for these use cases)  
14:44 <vmassol> checking the groovy macro first  
14:45 <vmassol> hmm strange  
14:45 <vmassol> if you have in a groovy macro: var = "toto"  
14:45 <vmassol> then you get "toto" printed  
14:45 <vmassol> so eval() returns "toto"  
14:45 <tmortagne> I guess groovy return var because it's the only thing you have defined  
14:46 <tmortagne> it's trying to be clever I guess  
14:47 <vmassol> it's the last command  
14:47 <vmassol> yes I think it's trying to be clever  
14:51 <vfzevaze> vmassol please create when possible a jira project for https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-encryption with dela fosse as owner (i am only contributing to it)  
14:51 <vmassol> actually the same happens in javacript for example: {{script language="javascript"}}i = 'toto';{{/script}}  
14:51 <vmassol> returns "toto"  
14:54 <vmassol> so it seems that my change is going to break too many things  
14:55 <vmassol> even though I also agree that output = false could be used to not output anything  
14:58 <vmassol> so the only thing that comes to mind right now is to introduce a new parameter to let the returned value be displayed or not (and make it off by default)  
14:59 <lucaa> has quit  
14:59 <vmassol> result=true|false  
14:59 <vmassol> tmortagne: wdyt?  
14:59 <tmortagne> well the returned value was already displayed, if it was a XDOM/Block  
15:00 <vmassol> yes those would need to use result=true in this case. Do we use that somewhere already?  
15:00 <vmassol> (it's a narrow use case)  
15:00 <tmortagne> someone might  
15:00 <tmortagne> disabling it would break things  
15:00 <vmassol> yes but breaking the backward compat for 2 persons in the world could be acceptable  
15:01 <tmortagne> while not using output=false when you don't want your macro to display anything is not really a good practice  
15:01 <vmassol> we could even leave the current behavior for XDOM  
15:01 <vmassol> yes i agree that output=false is the best  
15:01 <vmassol> but it's going to break a lot of places  
15:01 <tmortagne> not so sure about that  
15:01 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:02 <tmortagne> it will break things, but many I'm not sure  
15:02 <vmassol> I'm curious to see if it breaks the blog app for example  
15:02 <vmassol> probably not actually  
15:02 <vmassol> since it probably uses output=false  
15:02 <vmassol> (I'm mentioning the blog app becuase it has a lot of velocity scripting)  
15:02 <tmortagne> I'm -1 to disable XDOM/Block support all of a sudden in any case  
15:03 <msmeria> has quit  
15:03 <vmassol> so leave my stuff and document the new behavior and that you need to use output=false  
15:03 <vmassol> ?  
15:03 <vmassol> (and see what happens)  
15:03 <vmassol> ?  
15:03 <vmassol> :)  
15:04 <vmassol> (and fix the tests)  
15:04 <tmortagne> I don't know, maybe it should go in the mailing list  
15:04 <vmassol> ok sending mail  
15:10 <vmassol> vfzevaze: creating jira project  
15:12 <vmassol> (if internet allows me, I'm at a conference right now...)  
15:12 <vmassol> (and wifi is flaky)  
15:14 <vfzevaze> no hurry  
15:15 <vfzevaze> i am fixing a bug i would release it somewhen today or tomorrow  
15:15 <vmassol> vfzevaze: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/ENCRYPTAPP  
15:16 <vfzevaze> great!, thx  
15:19 <lucaa> has quit  
15:26 <vfzevaze> can yomeone please provide me with a link to the xwiki java format profile for eclipse?  
15:34 <tmortagne> vfzevaze: see http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/JavaCodeStyle#HEclipse3.x  
15:34 <tmortagne> the section title should be update to Eclipse 3 and more  
15:35 <tmortagne> another useful thing is http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DevelopmentTools#HEclipse-cs  
15:35 <tmortagne> but Eclipse cs is broken right now because of XCOMMONS-780  
15:38 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:45 <vmassol> bbl  
15:45 <vmassol> has quit  
15:45 <vfzevaze> tmortagne thx!

18:07 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
18:07 <vmassol> back home from paris  
18:09 <vfzevaze> vmassol welcome :)  
18:15 <vmassol> thanks  
18:15 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
18:17 <lucaa> has quit  
18:20 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
18:21 <vfzevaze> eclipse messes up with the license header when formattig xml (using default settings on eclipse 442)  
18:23 <vmassol> vfzevaze: really? that's bad eclipse!  
18:23 <vmassol> works fine in IDEA  
18:23 <vmassol> tmortagne: you have this problem too?  
18:23 <vmassol> vfzevaze: wait  
18:23 <vmassol> you must not use the default settings!  
18:24 <vmassol> vfzevaze: see http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/JavaCodeStyle#HConfiguringyourIDEtousetheXWikicodestyle  
18:24 <tmortagne> vfzevaze: you can configure XML formater and amon other things tell it to not touch comment  
18:25 <tmortagne> s/amon/among/  
18:27 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
18:27 <vmassol> tmortagne: the default codestyle doesn't do it?  
18:28 <vmassol> s/default/xwiki  
18:28 <tmortagne> vmassol: which codestyle  
18:28 <vmassol> xwiki  
18:28 <tmortagne> we provide java codestyle  
18:28 <vmassol> not xml?  
18:28 <vmassol> ok, I think the idea one also includes xml  
18:28 <vmassol> (I think it includes all languages)  
18:28 <tmortagne> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/tree/master/xwiki-commons-tools/xwiki-commons-tool-verification-resources/src/main/resources  
18:28 <tmortagne> java and javascript that's all  
18:29 <vmassol> (actually I'm sure)  
18:29 <vmassol> ok too bad  
18:29 <tmortagne> anyway I don't think XML plugin support anything as advanced as java ans javascript formatters, only a few options  
18:29 <tmortagne> I doubt you can export/import the configuration for it  
18:32 <lucaa> has quit  
18:34 <vfzevaze> vmassol i meant the xml default settings  
18:35 <vmassol> vfzevaze: my bad I htought we had xwiki XML codestyle for eclipse as we have for IDEA but I was wrong  
18:35 <vmassol> (I'm only using IDEA)  
18:35 <vfzevaze> maybe just a screenshot of the xml settings in eclipse documented in the javaCodeStyle page?  
18:35 <vmassol> yes it would be good to share them somehow  
18:36 <tmortagne> well looks like there is  
18:36 <tmortagne> see http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/XmlCodeStyle  
18:37 <tmortagne> but it's not right for the comment formating  
18:38 <vfzevaze> tmortgane perfect!  
18:39 <vmassol> cool, last time I saw this page it didn't have the eclipse part, that's nice  
18:40 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
18:40 <vfzevaze> thx, but it still messes up with the license tag, but that's an eclipse problem right?  
18:41 <vfzevaze> i will have to leave now  
18:42 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:42 <vfzevaze> another great day @ xwiki community  
18:42 <vfzevaze> bye!  
18:42 <vmassol> bye vfzevaze

21:54 <Trefex> hello  
21:54 <Trefex> http://www.xwiki.com/lang/en/XWikivsOtherSolutions/XWikivsDMS gives an error  
21:54 <Trefex> what gives?  
21:55 <vmassol1> indeed, I'll check with XWIKI SAS, thanks  
21:55 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
21:57 <lucaa> has quit  
22:03 <Trefex> thx  
22:06 <Trefex> vmassol: is it possible to mix LDAP and normal auth or it has to be one or the other?  
22:07 <vmassol> Trefex: I'm really not an expert but normally authentications can be chained  
22:08 <vmassol> thomas should be able to help you more tomorrow. Or you could ask on the list  
22:08 <Trefex> ah it says it very big in the beginning of http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Authentication  
22:08 <Trefex> no it's not possible  
22:08 <vmassol> ok  
22:08 <vmassol> hmm strange  
22:08 <vmassol> I was pretty sure there was a possibility to chain them  
22:09 <vmassol> I'm probably wrong, but maybe worth asking tomorrow  
22:09 <Trefex> maybe doc is outdated  
22:09 <Trefex> and lastly, do you know when v7 is released?  
22:09 <vmassol> next week  
22:11 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
22:11 <Trefex> cool thx  
22:12 <Trefex> i'm in the process of setting it up for the first time  
22:12 <Trefex> and it looks promising  
22:12 <vmassol> cool!  
22:13 <mflorea> has quit  
22:17 <Trefex> oh no, i did an apt-get upgrade and now it seems many icons in the admin part are broken as they get a 404  
22:18 <vmassol> refresh browser cache?  
22:18 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
22:19 <lucaa> has quit  
22:20 <Trefex> 2015-03-25 22:20:13.411https://lcsb-wiki.uni.lu/xwiki/bin/download/XWiki/AdminSheet/extensionmanager.png Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 (Not Found)  
22:20 <Trefex> etc...  
22:20 <Trefex> doesn't seem to be the cache, went from 6.4.something to latest stable  
22:21 <Trefex> or 6.3 or whaever came in February  
22:25 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
22:31 <Trefex> so i have broken wiki now :(  
22:32 <vmassol> oops, strange, would be interesting to report on the list what you've done exactly so that we can help you fix it  
22:33 <vmassol> (going to bed soon)
